trans-unit.source: Pauses script execution until a given process exists.

seg-source.mrk: Pauses script execution until a given process exists.

target.mrk: Pauses script execution until a given process exists.

trans-unit.source: The name of the process to check.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the process to check.

target.mrk: The name of the process to check.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies how long to wait (in seconds). Default is to wait indefinitely.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies how long to wait (in seconds).

target.mrk: Specifies how long to wait (in seconds).

trans-unit.source: Process names are executables without the full path, e.g., "notepad.exe" or "winword.exe"

seg-source.mrk: Process names are executables without the full path, e.g.,

target.mrk: Process names are executables without the full path, e.g.,

trans-unit.source: The process is polled approximately every 250 milliseconds.

seg-source.mrk: The process is polled approximately every 250 milliseconds.

target.mrk: The process is polled approximately every 250 milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: This function is the only process function not to accept a PID. Because PIDs are allocated randomly, waiting for a particular PID to exist doesn't make sense.

seg-source.mrk: This function is the only process function not to accept a PID.
Because PIDs are allocated randomly, waiting for a particular PID to exist doesn't make sense.

target.mrk: This function is the only process function not to accept a PID.
Because PIDs are allocated randomly, waiting for a particular PID to exist doesn't make sense.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the Notepad process to exist.

seg-source.mrk: Wait for the Notepad process to exist.

target.mrk: Wait for the Notepad process to exist.
